name: Kahimi Karie
description:
{{Nihongo|'''Mari Hiki'''|比企マリ|Hiki Mari|born March 15, 1968}}, better known by her stage name {{Nihongo|'''Kahimi Karie'''|カヒミ・カリィ|Kahimi Karii}}, is a Japanese singer, songwriter and photographer. Her music is closely associated with the [[Shibuya-kei]] aesthetic. Karie sings in English, French and Japanese, among other languages.

Karie began her music career in 1990 at the encouragement of fellow Shibuya-kei artist [[Cornelius (musician)|Cornelius]], whom she collaborated with on many of her early works, and whose trendy [[Trattoria Records|Trattoria]] label released many of her [[extended play|EP]]s in the mid-1990s. Karie later moved to [[Paris]] and released several studio albums on the Crue-L and [[Polydor Records|Polydor]] labels. She now lives in [[New York City]].
